name: Mad Snowboarding
description: A crazy open world snowboard game with a built-in level editor, which allows you to create own levels and share them with the community. There are always new levels to explore. Fight for worldwide highscores or play with up to four of your friends simultaneously in the split screen mode!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP/Vista/7/8/10 Processor: 1.8 GHz Processor Memory: 500 MB RAM Graphics: 3D graphics card compatible with DirectX Storage: 200 MB available space Sound Card: directx compatible

reviews.review_text: Do you like open world games where you attempt to reach the finish while trying to do awesome stunts in the meantime?If yes this is the game for you.I might have not played that much due to not having any free time ubt here is my opinion  Pros: Has multiplayer Has co-op Has a lot of modes to play Has level editor (this makes the possibilities endless It is a great time killer for people like me It is great fun to play even by yourself Gives you the option to play with a joystick and a keyboard Controls are easy to get used to   Cons:  It might be a bit pricy for some people   Overall this game has a lot of potential and it can be a great way to spend your free time.I would give it an 8/10. Now lets go to thethings i would personally like to see be added:  Currency:You get it throughout the map in the from of coins/shards and it is used for trading in a Yeti shop for new boards,cosmetics,single-use powerups for better scores or even map packs with a bunch of cool stages.  Wildlife:Animals like bears or penguins running around making you fail if you bump into them  Boss-type stages:A giant yeti chases you with a snowboard and you have to outrun it and finish before it catches you/Escape an avalance or types of stages like that.  Thank you mod for making this awesome game and i hope you consider my ideas worthy of using.Keep up te great work

Ugh. Like probably everyone else that bought this game or had it wishlisted, I was hoping for an SSX-type of game -- in my case for the open world racing, as I don't care about tricks. Unfortunately, with those expectations in mind, Mad Snowboarding ended up being a huge disappointment.  Note that I only played this for about half an hour, but it says something that by the end, playing to see what else this game offered was was quite a chore -- I would even characterize it as painful. I was bored out of my mind. In the levels I played, the world was very plain and dull. It isn't as 'open' as it looks, and I quickly ran into 'walls' when going not that far left or right. This is basically a really, really boring demo.  In my case, I bought this as a spare bundle key for about $0.20, so I'm not crying. But I would definitely encourage anyone wanting to pay full price to watch a lot of videos of this game and reading some of the more critical reviews before pulling the trigger.  Again, I only played half an hour, but half an hour into a game ... if it is that painfully boring, I find it hard to believe that the game would change dramatically after that. Maybe those creative types who enjoy designing stages and playing user-created levels will get more enjoyment out of it.  Seriously, why doesn't EA bring the SSX series to Steam? Even a port of an older SSX game will do. As it is, I suspect a lot of people will pick Mad Snowboarding up on sale to satisfy their SSX itch and end up disappointed.  1/10
